name: politico
text:
The pandemic has hobbled the weekly student protests that made Greta Thunberg and other campaigners a global phenomenon ‚Äî so they're now hitting up politicians in person.

German Chancellor Angela Merkel got a firsthand taste of that today
https://t.co/vQj6d9Zg0p

name: politico
text: Welcome to the last DNC night. Joe Biden will accept his nomination. Speakers: Gavin Newsom, Keisha Lance Bottoms, Sens. Tammy Duckworth, Cory Booker and more https://t.co/qoLV8PMk3G https://t.co/yNYvG3i9eA

name: politico
text:
The convention begins soon, at 9 p.m. ET.

We‚Äôre pregaming right now with our pre-show Foursquare, in which our reporters provide analysis and context to break down where we are and what to expect https://t.co/wtL6IVOjo0

name: politico
text:
From Iowa and New Hampshire to Bloomberg and Hunter, Biden's campaign was one near-death experience after another

https://t.co/LZQvlCsXpX

name: politico
text: The last night of the DNC begins now. Joe Biden will accept his nomination, and Cory Booker, Pete Buttigieg, Andrew Yang and others are set to speak. Live analysis: https://t.co/PDxCAkqMiW https://t.co/3nIl1S5nJx

text:

text:

https://t.co/ttDbCRgjs1

name: politico
text:
Biden's former 2020 rivals are squeezing their own campaign slogans into their speeches, notes @ec_schneider. Cory Booker's ‚Äúwe will rise‚Äù came up. Elizabeth Warren referenced how she loves a good plan. And Andrew Yang's math continued.

DNC live analysis
https://t.co/ttDbCRgjs1

name: politico
text:
Opinion: The Postal Service really does have big problems, and it really will be central to the election this year. 

The problems just aren‚Äôt the ones everyone is panicking about
https://t.co/EiNmE7qQEA

name: politico
text:
Democrats have spent three days casting the former VP as the antidote to Trump‚Äôs America, and on Thursday night, Joe Biden will personally deliver his case to the country.

Here are key moments from the evening üëáhttps://t.co/no9pV6yjbr

name: politico
text:
A former 2020 rival was noticeably absent from the DNC this week: Julian Castro.

The Biden campaign never seemed over Castro's debate remarks, where he seemed to insinuate that Biden was declining mentally (Castro denied that), says @AlxThomp
https://t.co/ttDbCRgjs1

name: politico
text:
The DNC tribute to Beau Biden is incredibly fitting, says @natashakorecki. He‚Äôs central to Joe's campaign.

Joe brings up Beau often on the trail. And each time, he can‚Äôt quite get through his anecdote without tearing up or stopping to collect his emotions
https://t.co/ttDbCRgjs1

name: politico
text: ‚ÄúWe have cried out for justice. We have gathered in our streets to demand change. And now, we must pass on the gift‚Ä¶ https://t.co/t172VRWzbN

name: politico
text:
In his DNC address, Pete Buttigieg leans into the theme of belonging, a big part of his presidential primary stump speech.

And based on his placement in the program, it's clear he‚Äôll likely play a role if there‚Äôs a Biden administration, says @ec_schneider
https://t.co/ttDbCRgjs1

name: politico
text:
Bloomberg‚Äôs DNC appearance has attracted a lot of blowback given that he stiffed his campaign staff that he attracted with promises of employment through November. 

But Dems want his money for the fall, so he gets a prime speaking slot, says @AlxThomp
https://t.co/ttDbCRgjs1

name: politico
text:
Cory Booker said his late grandfather ‚Äúwould be so proud‚Äù of the party's White House ticket if he were alive today:

‚ÄúJoe Biden and Kamala Harris know the dignity of all working Americans. They know the urgency and the demand of our dream,‚Äù Booker said https://t.co/Nt1ZP0ZLgM https://t.co/NcuLlizN8t

name: politico
text:
Joe Biden is preparing to take office in January with a unified national plan to defeat Covid-19, but he won't have a unified nation ready to follow it

https://t.co/Qg1bkkPtIv

name: politico
text:
Progressives are upset about Bloomberg's extended and primetime speaking role. 

This is another example of how Biden has benefitted from a virtual convention: There would be lots of booing from Bernie delegates if this were in person, says @hollyotterbein
https://t.co/ttDbCRgjs1

name: politico
text: RT @natashakorecki: This is the inside of the hall where Biden will speak. Only reporters, production folks and limited staff here. https://t.co/99ZdyhC4sT

name: politico
politico
text:
Quick takes on Joe Biden's DNC speech tonight:

He's channeling JFK-esque cadences
‚Äì @MarcACaputo

Has he said Donald Trump‚Äôs name? 
‚Äì @PoliticoCharlie

This direct-to-camera address is really working
‚Äì @ec_schneider.

More DNC live analysis:
https://t.co/ttDbCRgjs1

name: politico
text:
Joe Biden is taking a safe approach with his DNC speech, which seems smart, says @PoliticoCharlie. No attempts at soaring rhetoric, no harsh personal criticism of Trump ‚Äì in fact, no mention of Trump‚Äôs name at all so far. 

DNC live analysis:
https://t.co/ttDbCRgjs1

name: politico
text: Sen. Duckworth, an Iraq War veteran, condemned Trump as a ‚Äúcoward in chief‚Äù who was unfit to lead the nation‚Äôs mili‚Ä¶ https://t.co/gjhuvsF51q

name: politico
text:
Race has been a big part of Biden‚Äôs DNC speech, says @mayaaking. He opened with a quote from Ella Baker and is now leaning into the events in Charlottesville, something Biden has frequently cited as the reason he ultimately decided to run for president

https://t.co/ttDbCRgjs1

name: politico
text: In his early months on the job, Mike Pompeo raised alarms by seeking an unusual perk for a secretary of State: permission to rent a Washington, D.C.-area house that was controlled by the U.S. military https://t.co/189P7tnnit

name: politico
text:
Joe Biden did what he needed to do. No big slip ups, solid delivery, says @MarcACaputo. His campaign‚Äôs theory of the case is to be normal and commit as few unforced errors as possible.

More of our reporters' takes on Biden's DNC speech:
https://t.co/ttDbCRgjs1

name: politico
text:
It was striking that Joe Biden ended his DNC speech with a stare. No smile, no cheers. This was a serious speech for a serious moment, says @ec_schneider.  

He appealed to themes and values over policy, which is what we can expect from Trump, too
https://t.co/ttDbCRgjs1

name: politico
text: RT @natashakorecki: Biden calmly walked into a room without supporters and began delivering the biggest speech of his life. https://t.co/vXkv3qs1QL

name: politico
text:

https://t.co/vWHFf4beYI

name: politico
text:

https://t.co/xoadmP47dT

name: politico
text:

‚ÄúJoe Biden goes to church so regularly that he doesn‚Äôt even need tear gas and a bunch of federalized troops to help him get there,‚Äù she said at one point.

‚ÄúWill we be the generation that finally wipes out the stain of racism from our national character? I believe we're up to it. I believe we're ready.‚Äù ‚Äì Joe Biden

text:

text: RT @muoiod: New: The @MTA will no longer offer overnight Lyft, Uber services for riders affected by the end of 24/7 subway service.
